trans-unit.source: Gets information about the specified node.
trans-unit.target: Gets information about the specified node.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="0e07b9cb-8fdf-4ff7-b707-e964200df0f8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Common parameters and headers</link> for headers and parameters that are used by all requests related to nodes.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="0e07b9cb-8fdf-4ff7-b707-e964200df0f8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Common parameters and headers</link> for headers and parameters that are used by all requests related to nodes.

trans-unit.source: Replace {pool-id} with the id of the pool that contains the node.
trans-unit.target: Replace {pool-id} with the id of the pool that contains the node.

trans-unit.source: Replace {node-id} with the id of the node that you want to get information about.
trans-unit.target: Replace {node-id} with the id of the node that you want to get information about.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="e9da2d54-053a-4392-a5ba-26229c7cc9a5" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="e9da2d54-053a-4392-a5ba-26229c7cc9a5" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link>.

trans-unit.source: The current state of the node.
trans-unit.target: The current state of the node.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>creating</languageKeyword> – The Batch service has obtained the node, but it has not yet started to join a pool.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>creating</languageKeyword> – The Batch service has obtained the node, but it has not yet started to join a pool.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>starting</languageKeyword> – The Batch service is starting on the node.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>starting</languageKeyword> – The Batch service is starting on the node.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>waitingforstarttask</languageKeyword> – The start task has started running on the node, but waitForSuccess is set and the start task has not yet completed.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>waitingforstarttask</languageKeyword> – The start task has started running on the node, but waitForSuccess is set and the start task has not yet completed.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>starttaskfailed</languageKeyword> – The start task has failed on the node (and exhausted all retries), and waitForSuccess is set.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>starttaskfailed</languageKeyword> – The start task has failed on the node (and exhausted all retries), and waitForSuccess is set.

trans-unit.source: The node is not usable for running tasks.
trans-unit.target: The node is not usable for running tasks.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>idle</languageKeyword> – The node is not currently running a task.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>idle</languageKeyword> – The node is not currently running a task.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>running</languageKeyword> –The node is running one or more tasks (other than the start task).
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>running</languageKeyword> –The node is running one or more tasks (other than the start task).

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>leavingpool</languageKeyword> – The node is leaving the pool, either because the user explicitly removed it or because the pool is resizing or autoscaling down.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>leavingpool</languageKeyword> – The node is leaving the pool, either because the user explicitly removed it or because the pool is resizing or autoscaling down.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>unknown</languageKeyword> – The Batch service has lost contact with the node, and does not know its true state.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>unknown</languageKeyword> – The Batch service has lost contact with the node, and does not know its true state.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>unusable</languageKeyword> – The node cannot be used for task execution due to errors.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>unusable</languageKeyword> – The node cannot be used for task execution due to errors.

trans-unit.source: The time at which the node entered its current state.
trans-unit.target: The time at which the node entered its current state.

trans-unit.source: The time at which the node was started.
trans-unit.target: The time at which the node was started.

trans-unit.source: This property may not be present if the node state is <languageKeyword>unusable.</languageKeyword>
trans-unit.target: This property may not be present if the node state is <languageKeyword>unusable.</languageKeyword>

trans-unit.source: The time at which this node was allocated to the pool.
trans-unit.target: The time at which this node was allocated to the pool.

trans-unit.source: The IP address that other nodes can use to communicate with this node.
trans-unit.target: The IP address that other nodes can use to communicate with this node.

trans-unit.source: This element is present only if enableInterNodeCommunication is set to <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword> on the containing pool.
trans-unit.target: This element is present only if enableInterNodeCommunication is set to <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword> on the containing pool.

trans-unit.source: An identifier which can be passed in the Add Task API to request that the task be scheduled close to this compute node.
trans-unit.target: An identifier which can be passed in the Add Task API to request that the task be scheduled close to this compute node.

trans-unit.source: The size of the virtual machine hosting the compute node.
trans-unit.target: The size of the virtual machine hosting the compute node.

trans-unit.source: For information about available sizes of virtual machines, see <externalLink><linkText>Virtual Machine and Cloud Service Sizes for Azure</linkText><linkUri>https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/virtual-machines-size-specs/</linkUri></externalLink> .
trans-unit.target: For information about available sizes of virtual machines, see <externalLink><linkText>Virtual Machine and Cloud Service Sizes for Azure</linkText><linkUri>https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/virtual-machines-size-specs/</linkUri></externalLink> .

trans-unit.source: Batch supports all Azure VM sizes except ExtraSmall.
trans-unit.target: Batch supports all Azure VM sizes except ExtraSmall.

trans-unit.source: The total number of job tasks completed on the compute node.
trans-unit.target: The total number of job tasks completed on the compute node.

trans-unit.source: This includes Job Preparation, Job Release and Job Manager tasks, but not the pool start task.
trans-unit.target: This includes Job Preparation, Job Release and Job Manager tasks, but not the pool start task.

trans-unit.source: A list of tasks that are currently running on the node.
trans-unit.target: A list of tasks that are currently running on the node.

trans-unit.source: This property is present only if at least one task has run on this node since it was assigned to the pool.
trans-unit.target: This property is present only if at least one task has run on this node since it was assigned to the pool.

trans-unit.source: A task specified to run on the node as it joins the pool.
trans-unit.target: A task specified to run on the node as it joins the pool.

trans-unit.source: This element is present only if a start task is configured on the pool that contains the node.
trans-unit.target: This element is present only if a start task is configured on the pool that contains the node.

trans-unit.source: Runtime information about the execution of the start task on this node, including current state, error details, exit code, start time, end time, etc.
trans-unit.target: Runtime information about the execution of the start task on this node, including current state, error details, exit code, start time, end time, etc.

trans-unit.source: This element is present only if a start task is configured on the pool that contains the node.
trans-unit.target: This element is present only if a start task is configured on the pool that contains the node.

trans-unit.source: A list of certificates installed on the node.
trans-unit.target: A list of certificates installed on the node.

trans-unit.source: This element is present only if at least one certificate is configured to be installed on the pool that contains the node.
trans-unit.target: This element is present only if at least one certificate is configured to be installed on the pool that contains the node.

trans-unit.source: A list of errors that are currently being encountered by the node.
trans-unit.target: A list of errors that are currently being encountered by the node.

trans-unit.source: This element is present only if the node has any errors.
trans-unit.target: This element is present only if the node has any errors.

trans-unit.source: The id of the job to which the task belongs.
trans-unit.target: The id of the job to which the task belongs.

trans-unit.source: The id of the task within the job.
trans-unit.target: The id of the task within the job.

trans-unit.source: The current state of the task.
trans-unit.target: The current state of the task.

trans-unit.source: Information about the execution of the task.
trans-unit.target: Information about the execution of the task.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the command line of the start task.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the command line of the start task.

trans-unit.source: A list of files that Batch will download to the compute node before running the command line.
trans-unit.target: A list of files that Batch will download to the compute node before running the command line.

trans-unit.source: If you are providing the executable for the task, at least one instance of this element is required to specify the source location and target location of the executable file.
trans-unit.target: If you are providing the executable for the task, at least one instance of this element is required to specify the source location and target location of the executable file.

trans-unit.source: If the task requires additional supporting files, add additional instances of this element to list these files.
trans-unit.target: If the task requires additional supporting files, add additional instances of this element to list these files.

trans-unit.source: Files that listed under this element are located in the task’s wd directory.
trans-unit.target: Files that listed under this element are located in the task’s wd directory.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="6e4a5e67-dc09-4de2-8ae9-88a30987fcfb" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List the task files in an account</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="6e4a5e67-dc09-4de2-8ae9-88a30987fcfb" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List the task files in an account</link>.

trans-unit.source: If the command line is a default server program, and requires no additional supporting files, you do not need to include this element.
trans-unit.target: If the command line is a default server program, and requires no additional supporting files, you do not need to include this element.

trans-unit.source: A list of environment variable settings for the start task.
trans-unit.target: A list of environment variable settings for the start task.

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether to run the start task in elevated mode.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether to run the start task in elevated mode.

trans-unit.source: The maximum number of times the task may be retried.
trans-unit.target: The maximum number of times the task may be retried.

trans-unit.source: The Batch service retries a task if its exit code is nonzero.
trans-unit.target: The Batch service retries a task if its exit code is nonzero.

trans-unit.source: Note that this value specifically controls the number of retries.
trans-unit.target: Note that this value specifically controls the number of retries.

trans-unit.source: The Batch service will try the task once, and may then retry up to this limit.
trans-unit.target: The Batch service will try the task once, and may then retry up to this limit.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the maximum retry count is 3, Batch tries the task up to 4 times (one initial try and 3 retries).
trans-unit.target: For example, if the maximum retry count is 3, Batch tries the task up to 4 times (one initial try and 3 retries).

trans-unit.source: If the maximum retry count is 0, the Batch service does not retry the task.
trans-unit.target: If the maximum retry count is 0, the Batch service does not retry the task.

trans-unit.source: If the maximum retry count is -1, the Batch service retries the task without limit.
trans-unit.target: If the maximum retry count is -1, the Batch service retries the task without limit.

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether the Batch Service should wait for the start task to complete successfully (that is, to exit with exit code 0) before scheduling any tasks on the compute node.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether the Batch Service should wait for the start task to complete successfully (that is, to exit with exit code 0) before scheduling any tasks on the compute node.

trans-unit.source: If <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword> and the start task fails on a compute node, the Batch service retries the start task up to its maximum retry count (maxTaskRetryCount).
trans-unit.target: If <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword> and the start task fails on a compute node, the Batch service retries the start task up to its maximum retry count (maxTaskRetryCount).

trans-unit.source: If the task has still not completed successfully after all retries, then the Batch service marks the compute node unusable, and will not schedule tasks to it.
trans-unit.target: If the task has still not completed successfully after all retries, then the Batch service marks the compute node unusable, and will not schedule tasks to it.

trans-unit.source: This condition can be detected via the node state and scheduling error detail.
trans-unit.target: This condition can be detected via the node state and scheduling error detail.

trans-unit.source: If <languageKeyword>false</languageKeyword>, the Batch service will not wait for the start task to complete.
trans-unit.target: If <languageKeyword>false</languageKeyword>, the Batch service will not wait for the start task to complete.

trans-unit.source: In this case, other tasks can start executing on the compute node while the start task is still running; and even if the start task fails, new tasks will continue to be scheduled on the node.
trans-unit.target: In this case, other tasks can start executing on the compute node while the start task is still running; and even if the start task fails, new tasks will continue to be scheduled on the node.

trans-unit.source: The URL of a blob in Azure storage.
trans-unit.target: The URL of a blob in Azure storage.

trans-unit.source: The Batch service downloads the blob to the specified file path.
trans-unit.target: The Batch service downloads the blob to the specified file path.

trans-unit.source: The URL must be readable using anonymous access; that is, the Batch service does not present any credentials when downloading the blob.
trans-unit.target: The URL must be readable using anonymous access; that is, the Batch service does not present any credentials when downloading the blob.

trans-unit.source: There are two ways to get such a URL for a blob in Azure storage:
trans-unit.target: There are two ways to get such a URL for a blob in Azure storage:

trans-unit.source: Use a Shared Access Signature (SAS) granting read permissions on the blob.
trans-unit.target: Use a Shared Access Signature (SAS) granting read permissions on the blob.

trans-unit.source: Set the ACL for the blob’s container to allow public access.
trans-unit.target: Set the ACL for the blob’s container to allow public access.

trans-unit.source: The location on the compute node to which the file should be downloaded.
trans-unit.target: The location on the compute node to which the file should be downloaded.

trans-unit.source: The name of the environment variable.
trans-unit.target: The name of the environment variable.

trans-unit.source: The value of the environment variable.
trans-unit.target: The value of the environment variable.

trans-unit.source: The state of the start task on the node.
trans-unit.target: The state of the start task on the node.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>running</languageKeyword> – The start task is currently running.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>running</languageKeyword> – The start task is currently running.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>completed</languageKeyword> – The start task has exited with exit code 0, or the start task has failed and the retry limit has reached, or the start task process did not run due to scheduling errors.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>completed</languageKeyword> – The start task has exited with exit code 0, or the start task has failed and the retry limit has reached, or the start task process did not run due to scheduling errors.

trans-unit.source: The time at which the start task started running.
trans-unit.target: The time at which the start task started running.

trans-unit.source: This value is reset every time the task is restarted or retried (that is, this is the most recent time at which the start task started running).
trans-unit.target: This value is reset every time the task is restarted or retried (that is, this is the most recent time at which the start task started running).

trans-unit.source: The time at which the start task stopped running.
trans-unit.target: The time at which the start task stopped running.

trans-unit.source: This is the end time of the most recent run of the start task, if that run has completed (even if that run failed and a retry is pending).
trans-unit.target: This is the end time of the most recent run of the start task, if that run has completed (even if that run failed and a retry is pending).

trans-unit.source: This element is not present if the start task is currently running.
trans-unit.target: This element is not present if the start task is currently running.

trans-unit.source: The exit code of the start task.
trans-unit.target: The exit code of the start task.

trans-unit.source: If the start task has run more than once this is the exit code of the most recent run to have completed.
trans-unit.target: If the start task has run more than once this is the exit code of the most recent run to have completed.

trans-unit.source: This element is not present if the start task has never run to completion.
trans-unit.target: This element is not present if the start task has never run to completion.

trans-unit.source: If there was an error scheduling the start task, this element contains the error details.
trans-unit.target: If there was an error scheduling the start task, this element contains the error details.

trans-unit.source: The number of times the task has been retried by the Batch service.
trans-unit.target: The number of times the task has been retried by the Batch service.

trans-unit.source: The task is retried if it exits with a nonzero exit code, up to the specified MaxTaskRetryCount.
trans-unit.target: The task is retried if it exits with a nonzero exit code, up to the specified MaxTaskRetryCount.

trans-unit.source: The most recent time at which a retry of the task started running.
trans-unit.target: The most recent time at which a retry of the task started running.

trans-unit.source: This element is present only if the task was retried (i.e. retryCount is nonzero).
trans-unit.target: This element is present only if the task was retried (i.e. retryCount is nonzero).

trans-unit.source: If present, this is typically the same as startTime, but may be different if the task has been restarted for reasons other than retry; for example, if the compute node was rebooted during a retry, then the startTime is updated but the lastRetryTime is not.
trans-unit.target: If present, this is typically the same as startTime, but may be different if the task has been restarted for reasons other than retry; for example, if the compute node was rebooted during a retry, then the startTime is updated but the lastRetryTime is not.

trans-unit.source: The algorithm with which the thumbprint is associated.
trans-unit.target: The algorithm with which the thumbprint is associated.

trans-unit.source: The location of the certificate store on the compute node into which to install the certificate.
trans-unit.target: The location of the certificate store on the compute node into which to install the certificate.

trans-unit.source: The name of the certificate store on the compute node into which to install the certificate.
trans-unit.target: The name of the certificate store on the compute node into which to install the certificate.

trans-unit.source: Specifies which user accounts on the compute node should have access to the private data of the certificate.
trans-unit.target: Specifies which user accounts on the compute node should have access to the private data of the certificate.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>starttask</languageKeyword> – The user account under which the start task is run.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>starttask</languageKeyword> – The user account under which the start task is run.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>task</languageKeyword> – The accounts under which job tasks are run.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>task</languageKeyword> – The accounts under which job tasks are run.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>rdp</languageKeyword> – The accounts under which users remotely access the node (using Remote Desktop).
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>rdp</languageKeyword> – The accounts under which users remotely access the node (using Remote Desktop).

trans-unit.source: You can specify more than one value by providing a comma-separated list.
trans-unit.target: You can specify more than one value by providing a comma-separated list.

trans-unit.source: For example, starttask,task grants access to both the start task and job tasks, but not RDP users.
trans-unit.target: For example, starttask,task grants access to both the start task and job tasks, but not RDP users.

trans-unit.source: The default is that the certificate is visible to all the user accounts listed above, i.e. a value of starttask,task,rdp.
trans-unit.target: The default is that the certificate is visible to all the user accounts listed above, i.e. a value of starttask,task,rdp.

trans-unit.source: The time at which the task started running.
trans-unit.target: The time at which the task started running.

trans-unit.source: If the task has been restarted or retried, this is the most recent time at which the task started running.
trans-unit.target: If the task has been restarted or retried, this is the most recent time at which the task started running.

trans-unit.source: This property is present only for tasks that are in the <languageKeyword>running</languageKeyword> or <languageKeyword>completed</languageKeyword> state.
trans-unit.target: This property is present only for tasks that are in the <languageKeyword>running</languageKeyword> or <languageKeyword>completed</languageKeyword> state.

trans-unit.source: The time at which the task completed.
trans-unit.target: The time at which the task completed.

trans-unit.source: This property is present only if the task is in the <languageKeyword>completed</languageKeyword> state.
trans-unit.target: This property is present only if the task is in the <languageKeyword>completed</languageKeyword> state.

trans-unit.source: The exit code of the task.
trans-unit.target: The exit code of the task.

trans-unit.source: This property is present only if the task is in <languageKeyword>completed</languageKeyword> state.
trans-unit.target: This property is present only if the task is in <languageKeyword>completed</languageKeyword> state.

trans-unit.source: If there was an error scheduling the task, and the task is now in a <languageKeyword>completed</languageKeyword> state, this element contains the error details.
trans-unit.target: If there was an error scheduling the task, and the task is now in a <languageKeyword>completed</languageKeyword> state, this element contains the error details.

trans-unit.source: The number of times the task has been retried by the Batch service.
trans-unit.target: The number of times the task has been retried by the Batch service.

trans-unit.source: The task is retried if it exits with a nonzero exit code, up to the specified MaxTaskRetryCount.
trans-unit.target: The task is retried if it exits with a nonzero exit code, up to the specified MaxTaskRetryCount.

trans-unit.source: The most recent time at which a retry of the task started running.
trans-unit.target: The most recent time at which a retry of the task started running.

trans-unit.source: This element is present only if the task was retried (i.e. retryCount is nonzero).
trans-unit.target: This element is present only if the task was retried (i.e. retryCount is nonzero).

trans-unit.source: If present, this is typically the same as startTime, but may be different if the task has been restarted for reasons other than retry; for example, if the compute node was rebooted during a retry, then the startTime is updated but the lastRetryTime is not.
trans-unit.target: If present, this is typically the same as startTime, but may be different if the task has been restarted for reasons other than retry; for example, if the compute node was rebooted during a retry, then the startTime is updated but the lastRetryTime is not.

trans-unit.source: The number of times the task has been requeued by the Batch service as the result of a user request.
trans-unit.target: The number of times the task has been requeued by the Batch service as the result of a user request.

trans-unit.source: When the user removes nodes from a pool (by resizing/shrinking the pool) or when the job is being disabled, the user can specify that running tasks on the nodes be requeued for execution.
trans-unit.target: When the user removes nodes from a pool (by resizing/shrinking the pool) or when the job is being disabled, the user can specify that running tasks on the nodes be requeued for execution.

trans-unit.source: This count tracks how many times the task has been requeued for these reasons.
trans-unit.target: This count tracks how many times the task has been requeued for these reasons.

trans-unit.source: The most recent time at which the task has been requeued by the Batch service as the result of a user request.
trans-unit.target: The most recent time at which the task has been requeued by the Batch service as the result of a user request.

trans-unit.source: This property is present only if the requeueCount is nonzero.
trans-unit.target: This property is present only if the requeueCount is nonzero.

trans-unit.source: The category of the task scheduling error.
trans-unit.target: The category of the task scheduling error.

trans-unit.source: An identifier for the task scheduling error.
trans-unit.target: An identifier for the task scheduling error.

trans-unit.source: Codes are invariant and are intended to be consumed programmatically.
trans-unit.target: Codes are invariant and are intended to be consumed programmatically.

trans-unit.source: A message describing the task scheduling error, intended to be suitable for display in a user interface.
trans-unit.target: A message describing the task scheduling error, intended to be suitable for display in a user interface.

trans-unit.source: A list of additional error details related to the scheduling error.
trans-unit.target: A list of additional error details related to the scheduling error.

trans-unit.source: Every node that is added to a pool is assigned a unique id and IP address.
trans-unit.target: Every node that is added to a pool is assigned a unique id and IP address.

trans-unit.source: Whenever a node is removed from a pool, all of its local files are deleted, and the id and IP address are reclaimed and could be reused for new nodes.
trans-unit.target: Whenever a node is removed from a pool, all of its local files are deleted, and the id and IP address are reclaimed and could be reused for new nodes.
